1.text: Scribes and Pharisees then came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying:

2.text: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the presbyters? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”

3.text: Jesus answered them, “Why do you also disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?

4.text: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever speaks evil of father or mother should be put to death.’

5.text: But you say, ‘Anyone may tell his father or his mother, “Whatever support you might otherwise have received from me is now a gift devoted to God,” and is not bound to honor his father or mother.’

6.text: Thus, you have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition.

7.text: You hypocrites! Isaias (Isaiah) prophesied about you quite well when he said:

8.text: These people draw near to me with their mouth,   and honor me with their lips;   but their heart is far from me!

9.text: In vain do they express adoration to me,   teaching as doctrine rules made by men.

10.text: Jesus gathered the crowds and said to them, “Hear, and understand.

11.text: What enters into the mouth does not defile a person, but what comes out of the mouth, this is what defiles a person.”

12.text: Then his disciples came and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”

13.text: But Jesus answered, “Every plant which my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.

14.text: Leave them alone! They are blind guides of the blind; and if the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”

15.text: Peter said to him, “Explain this parable to us.”

16.text: And so, Jesus answered, “Do you still fail to understand?

17.text: Do you not yet understand that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the stomach and then out of the body?

18.text: But the things which come out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile the person.

19.text: Indeed, it is from the heart that evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual sins, thefts, false witness, and blasphemies come forth.

20.text: These are the things which defile a person; but to eat with unwashed hands does not make anyone impure.”

21.text: Jesus then left that area and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.

22.text: Behold, a Canaanite woman came out from those borders and cried out, “Have mercy on me, Lord, son of David! My daughter is severely demonized!”

23.text: But Jesus did not answer her a word. His disciples came and begged him, saying, “Send her away! She is shouting after us!”

24.text: However, Jesus answered, “I was not sent to anyone but the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

25.text: Still, the woman came forward and expressed adoration to him, saying, “Lord, help me.”

26.text: But he answered, “It is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the little dogs.”

27.text: But she replied, “Yes, Lord, but even the little dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”

28.text: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, great is your faith! Let it be it done to you even as you desire.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.

29.text: Jesus departed and came near the sea of Galilee. He went up into the mountain and sat there.

30.text: Great crowds came to Jesus, bringing with them the lame, blind, mute, crippled, and many others; and they put them down at his feet. So he healed them,

31.text: and the crowds were amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.

32.text: Jesus called his disciples and said, “I have compassion on the crowd because they have remained with me for three days now and they have nothing to eat. I do not want to send them away hungry, or they might faint on the way.”

33.text: His disciples said to him, “But where should we get so many loaves in a deserted place in order to satisfy such a great multitude?”

34.text: Jesus asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They replied, “Seven, and a few small fish.”

35.text: Jesus then told the people to sit down on the ground

36.text: and took the seven loaves and the fish. He gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to his disciples, and the disciples distributed [the food] to the multitudes.

37.text: Everyone ate and was satisfied. They gathered up seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.

38.text: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

39.text: Then Jesus sent the people away, got into the boat, and came to the borders of Magdala.
